III.ii.1.A.2.i
.
Preparing a Final Notification Letter for VAMC or VR&E Records
Under
38 CFR 3.159(e)
, ROs are required to notify the claimant when they conclude reasonably identified VA medical or VR&E records do not exist or further efforts to obtain them would be futile.
When the RO is unable to obtain the records, prepare a final notification letter that identifies the
VAMC/VR&E office(s)
disability(ies) and/or reason for treatment/counseling, and
date range of the unavailable records.
Important
:
The format of the final notification letter may be determined based on the individual case, as dictated by
M21-1, Part III, Subpart ii, 1.A.1.g
.
Apply the same case-by-case considerations identified in
M21-1, Part III, Subpart ii, 1.A.2.h
, when documenting records that are unavailable.
References
:  For more information on
determining relevancy of records, see
M21-1, Part III, Subpart i, 2.E
, and
the notice of inability to obtain Federal records, see
M21-1, Part III, Subpart i, 2.C.3.b
.
